name: sprintf
description: The sprintf() function formats and stores a series of characters and values in the array pointed to by s. Each argument (if any) is converted and output according to the corresponding format specifier in the format string.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: Pointer to a buffer where the resulting C-string is stored.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: C string that contains a format string that follows the same specifications as format in printf.

return_description: On success, the total number of characters written is returned. This count does not include the additional null-character automatically appended at the end of the string.
safety:
Cancellation point: No
Interrupt handler: Yes
Signal handler: Yes
Thread safe: Yes
